title: Bank Indonesia Will Bring Rupiah to Trade at 16,500 per Dollar Next Year
description:
Source: Reuters | Editor: Herlina Kartika Dewi

MACROECONOMICS - JAKARTA. The governor of Indonesia's central bank said on Monday that Bank Indonesia would next year bring the rupiah to trade at 16,500 per U.S. dollar, or even 16,400, adding he is committed to maintaining stability in the currency.

description: TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesia has joined the multilateral development bank, the New Development Bank (NDB), after officially becoming a member of the intergovernmental organization, BRICS. title: Indonesia central bank keeps policy rates unchanged, as expected
description: JAKARTA: Indonesia's central bank kept its policy rates unchanged on Wednesday, as expected, saying current levels were consistent with efforts to keep the rupiah currency stable and ensure inflation remains within target.Growth in Southeast Asia's largest economy fell slightly last year amid fallin...

title: Indonesia's October trade surplus smaller than expected
description:
JAKARTA: Indonesia posted a smaller-than-expected trade surplus in October after exports unexpectedly fell on the back of lower shipments of mining products, official data showed on Monday.

In October, the surplus stood at $2.4 billion, smaller than the $3.72 billion forecast by economists polled b...

title: Freeport Indonesia: A Major Contributor to National Economy
description:
Jakarta. Mining giant Freeport Indonesia (PTFI) has long been a major contributor to the Indonesian economy, including at the regional level in Papua or specifically Mimika.

title: Strength of next govt’s mandate to influence fiscal consolidation: Moody’s
description:

title: Bank Indonesia projecting 5.3% economic growth for next year
description:
JAKARTA: Bank Indonesia (BI) has projected Indonesia’s gross domestic product (GDP) to grow by around 5.3% year-on-year in 2026, supported by rising consumption and investment.

title: BPS Logs 0.17% Inflation in November 2025
description:
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Statistics Indonesia (BPS) recorded a 0.17 percent (month-to-month) inflation in November 2025. Meanwhile, the year-on-year and year-to-date inflation are recorded at 2.72 percent and 2.27 percent, respectively.

title: Indonesia March inflation quickens to fastest in 7 months
description: JAKARTA: Indonesia's annual inflation rate accelerated more than expected in March to 3.05%, the quickest since August 2023, amid rising demand during the fasting month of Ramadan, data from the statistics bureau showed on Monday.A Reuters poll of economists had expected an inflation rate of 2.91% i...

title: Indonesia February inflation rate beats view on soaring rice, chilli prices
description: JAKARTA: Indonesia 's February inflation rate beat forecasts on surging food prices, government data showed on Friday, but stayed within the central bank's targeted range, reinforcing market views that any rate cuts will come only in the second half of 2024.The monthly inflation rate accelerated to ...

title: Indonesia's central bank holds rates steady to ease rupiah pressures
description:
JAKARTA (Reuters) -- Bank Indonesia held its key interest rates unchanged for a second straight policy review on Wednesday, as expected, opting to continue with efforts to reinforce the impact of past rate cuts as the rupiah comes under renewed pressure.

title: Bank Indonesia to Gather Entrepreneurs and Banks to Discuss Credit
description:
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Governor of Bank Indonesia (BI) Perry Warjiyo stated that the institution will gather entrepreneurs and the banking sector in a forum to discuss credit. This is done to find solutions in boosting credit demand.

title: Indonesia agrees to scrap all tariffs on 99% US goods, secures 13% tariff cut in return
description:
Indonesia has agreed to eliminate tariffs on more than 99% of U.S. goods and scrap all non-tariff barriers facing American firms, while the U.S. will drop threatened tariffs on Indonesian products to 19% from 32%, the two countries said on Tuesday.
